title: Loch Oire Walking Route

images.title: Anne Burgess / Loch Oire
images.caption: Loch Oire. Much of the surface of the loch seems to be covered with water weed. The loch lies in what may be a kettle hole, surrounded by thickly wooded ridges.

images.title: Ann Harrison / Loch Oire
images.caption: Loch Oire was adjacent to the A96 but due to realignment of this road it is no longer seen from passing traffic.

images.title: Anne Burgess / A Fine Family (2)
images.caption: A Fine Family. The cob, pen and seven cygnets came over to investigate me when I appeared at the water's edge.

images.title: Des Colhoun / The "big" house at Loch Na Bo.
images.caption: The "big" house at Loch Na Bo just to the south west of Loch Oire.

images.title: Ann Harrison / Monkey Puzzle Tree at Loch na Bo
images.caption: Monkey Puzzle Tree at Loch na Bo

images.title: Des Colhoun / Davy's cottage at Loch na Bo.
images.caption: Davy's cottage at Loch na Bo. In the background you can see the fishing boats by Davy's cottage. The loch has a good head of spirited brown trout and a day on this water is something to savour.

description: Enjoy a little walk along the shores of the lovely Loch Oire in Elgin, Moray. The pretty loch is located just to the east of Lhanbryde. It's a great place for a peaceful stroll with lots of wildlife to see on the water. You can park your car in the small lay-by on the eastern side of the loch at Threapland to start yourself off. The walk can be extended by following a trail south east through the woods to the nearby Loch na Bo.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head east towards Fochabers and you could pick up the epic Speyside Way and enjoy a riverside walk. Head west and you could pick up the cycling and walking trails in the expansive Culbin Forest in Nairn.

display_address: A96, Lhanbryde, Moray, Alba / Scotland, IV30 8LL, United Kingdom
